intro: Erythrococca fischeri, commonly known as the red cocculus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and showy, red flowers. The plant produces distinctive, spherical fruits that contain a single seed. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
